Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS)
description: A rare autoimmune disorder characterized by the simultaneous occurrence of thrombocytopenia (low platelet count) and hemolytic anemia (destruction of red blood cells).

treatment: Treatment typically involves immunosuppressive therapy, such as corticosteroids or other medications that suppress the immune system.},
        {name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can affect multiple organs, including the skin, joints, kidneys, and blood cells.

treatment: Treatment aims to suppress the overactive immune system and prevent further damage to organs.},
        {name: Idiopathic Thrombocytopenic Purpura (ITP)
description: An autoimmune disorder that causes the destruction of platelets, leading to easy bruising and bleeding.

treatment: Treatment may include medications to increase platelet production or to suppress the immune system.},
        {name: Antiphospholipid Syndrome (APS)
description: An autoimmune disorder that causes the formation of blood clots in the arteries and veins.

treatment: Treatment typically involves blood thinners to prevent blood clots.},
        {name: Churg-Strauss Syndrome
description: A rare inflammatory disorder that affects small and medium-sized blood vessels, often in the lungs and sinuses.

treatment: Treatment typically involves corticosteroids and other immunosuppressive medications.},
        {name: Microscopic Polyangiitis
description: A rare autoimmune disease that causes inflammation of small blood vessels, typically in the kidneys and lungs.

treatment: Treatment typically involves corticosteroids and other immunosuppressive medications.},
        {name: Henoch-Schonlein Purpura
description: A condition that causes inflammation of small blood vessels, leading to a rash, joint pain, and abdominal pain.

treatment: Treatment typically involves corticosteroids and other medications to reduce inflammation.},
        {name: Wegener’s Granulomatosis
description: A rare disease that causes inflammation of the blood vessels and the tissues around them, often in the nose, sinuses, and lungs.

treatment: Treatment typically involves corticosteroids and other immunosuppressive medications.},
        {name: Polyarteritis Nodosa
description: A rare autoimmune disease that causes inflammation of medium-sized arteries throughout the body.

treatment: Treatment typically involves corticosteroids and other immunosuppressive medications.},
        {name: Thrombotic Thrombocytopenic Purpura (TTP)
description: A rare and serious condition that causes blood clots to form in small blood vessels throughout the body.
treatment: Treatment typically involves a medication called plasmapheresis, which removes harmful antibodies from the blood.}
